message: Hi Bob, I'm selling a unique product that I believe will be of great value to you. I'm asking for $10000 for it, but I'm open to negotiation. What are your thoughts?
I'm interested in the product, but $10000 is a bit steep for me. I was thinking more along the lines of $7000. Can you consider that?

Bob, I appreciate your interest and understand your offer.  While $7000 is below my minimum, I'm willing to come down to $8500. This reflects the value of the product and leaves room for both of us to be happy with the deal. Let me know your thoughts.
I appreciate your willingness to come down, but $8500 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $7500 for the product. Can you consider that?

Bob, I understand your budget concerns. While $7500 is still below my desired price point, I'm willing to make one final concession. I'll offer the product for $8000. This is my absolute bottom line, as it reflects the minimum value I'm willing to accept. Let me know if you're able to accept this offer.
I appreciate your final concession, but $8000 is still a bit above my target. I'm willing to pay $7200 for the product. Can you consider that?
